short_summary: The Department of Justice Canada requires office chairs to install in several cities across Canada
description: This tender announcement is an amendment to an existing tender soliciting office chairs for the Department of Justice Canada. Previously, the tender was set to close on January 13, 2023, however, this amendment addresses some earlier questions. The successful supplier will need to provide, deliver, and install office chairs to Toronto, Ottawa, Halifax, Vancouver, Montreal, and Edmonton. All chairs must be received by March 31, 2023. Additionally, this tender is designated for pre-qualified holders of TPSGC Supply Arrangement. Non-TSAGC holders can bid but must also arrange a Supply Arrangement with the TPSGC. Inquiries regarding this tender can be directed to the Government of Canada via the provided email address. Please follow the specified link to find out more about qualifying for the TPSGC Supply Arrangement.

### Tender Description
The Department of Justice Canada requires the purchase, delivery, and installation of office seating to several locations across Canada by March 31, 2023. This requirement falls under the Department's Supply Arrangement (SA) #E60PQ-120001/G and is set aside for Aboriginal businesses and small and minority businesses. Suppliers must be pre-qualified and have a valid supply arrangement to participate in this tender. Non-SA holders can submit a bid but must also apply for a supply arrangement.

### Notice
This notice replaces previous versions dated January 2, 2023. Amendments to this bid will be published on [website URL]. Inquiries regarding this requirement should be directed to the Contracting Authority via email: JUS.L_MTL-OTT_BRQ_Acquisitions___Acquisitions_QRO_MTL-OTT_L.JUS@justice.gc.ca. Suppliers with questions about becoming a pre-qualified SA holder should contact RCNAmeublement.NCRF
